source.03704b8b:
-The value of the Turkish Lira and the amount of money spent per person have a positive strong relationship as they are both declining over the years. As a result, the value of the Turkish currency decreases and the tourists' money becomes more valuable, and accordingly, it allows them to spend less than they would in their native currency.

-There is a very strong positive relationship between total revenue and total tourists. This makes sense because if the total number of tourists increases, the total income will increase.

-Total revenue and expenditure per capita have a weak negative relationship. We have seen that, more often than not, the total revenue is on a rising graph; the fact that it is on a fluctuating, although not sharply falling, graph in per capita expenditures confirms this relationship.

-There is a strong negative relationship between spending per person and total tourist. This also makes sense because we have seen graps total number of tourist was always rising in other side value of Turkish Lira was losing value.

-

-Toplam gelir ve toplam insan rakamlari arasinda pozitif ve guclu bir iliski var. Bu mantikli cunku toplam turist sayisi cogalirsa toplam gelir artar.

-Toplam gelir ve kisi basi harcama da zayif seviyede negatif iliski var. toplam gelirin kismen de olsa yukselen bir grafikte oldugunu gormustuk, onun yani sira kisi basi harcalamalarinda keskin olmasada dalgali dusen bir grafikte olmasi bu orani karsiliyor.

-Turk lirasinin degeri ve yillar icinde kisi basina harcanan para miktari pozitif bir iliski soz konusu.
Buna sebep olarak turk parasinin degerinin dusmesiyle turistlerin paralarinin daha degerlenmesi ve buna istinaden alacagi servis veya urunu kendi para birimine gore daha ucuz almasini saglar ve buda kisi basina harcayacagi para miktari duser, turk lirasinin degeri dusmesi gibi.

-Turk Lirasi ve kisi basi toplam turist sayisi arasinda negatif yonde guclu iliski goruyoruz bunun da sebebi Turk Lirasi gunden gune deger kaybederken turist sayisinin da yillar icersinde yukselen bir grafikte olmasidir.

Burada ise Yaz aylarindaki ortalama gelen turist sayilari bunu kanitlamakta.

source.ecad9883:
I remember hearing about and experiencing that the number of tourists in Europe and other first world countries (such as the USA, Australia, New Zealand, Japan) decreased and their tourist revenues, directly or indirectly, have therefore decreased.
Let's check it out by looking at the numbers.

-

Daha once turist beldelerinde calismis oldugumdan ve cevremden duydugum ve deneyimlerimden yola cikarak, Avrupali ve diger birinci dunya ulkerindeki (ABD, Avusturalya, Yeni Zellanda, Japonya gibi ) turist sayilarinin dustugunun ve bunlarin direkt veya indirekt olarak turist gelirlerinin dustugune yonelik yakinimlari hatirliyorum.
Hadi bunu rakamlara bakarak dogrulugunu olcelim.
source.b6bfee93:
Here, a sharp decline is seen in the Turkish Lira against the US Dollar. After seeing this graph, we cannot attribute the decrease in the amount of money spent by tourists per capita to the change in tourists' origin countries.

-

Burada turk lirasinin dolar karsisinda keskin dusus gorulmekte. Bu grafigi gordukten sonra, turistlerin kisi basi harcagi parada ki dususu sadece turist gonderen ulkelerdeki degisime baglayamayiz.
source.676fbadc:
I eliminated extra zeros from the data by dividing it by 100.

-

Veriden ekstra sifirlari 100 e bolerek yok ediyorum.
source.960a29c0:
Looking this scatter plots, we would easily say between total people of tourist and total revenue has strong positive linear relationship.
Let's check the correlation coefficients.

-

Scatter grafiklerine baktigimizda en cok gozumuze carpan toplam gelir ve turist sayisi arasindaki dogrusal pozitif guclu iliski. Bunlari rakamlarla aciklamak icin korelasyon katsayilarina bakalim.
source.f48850f7:
As I mentioned before, I heard in the places I worked that European tourists spend less money than Middle Eastern tourists.
In our previous analysis, we saw that tourists from developed countries prefer Turkey less.
There is a big difference especially between 2008 and 2018. Let's take a look at the 30 countries that sent the most tourists in these two years.

In the graph here, the money spent by tourists per capita is shown in US Dollars; although it has decreased from $950 to below $775, there is an increase in recent years.
I know that the Turkish Lira has lost a lot of value in the last 10 years. Since this loss of value makes the currency of tourists more valuable, the prices of services and products that tourists can receive will be lower compared to their native currency, even if their expenditures remain at the same level. This results in them spending less than the Turkish Lira they would normally spend. For this reason, let's see the graph of the exchange rate difference between the Turkish Lira and the US Dollar.

-

Daha once bahsettigim gibi calistigim yerlerde bazi yakinmalara sahit oldum. Avrupali turistlerin ortadogulu turistlere gore daha az para harcamasindan bahsediliyordu.
Gelismis ulkelerden gelen turistlerin Turkiye'yi daha az tercih ettigini onceki analizimizde gormustuk. 
Ozellikle 2008 yili ve 2018 yili arasinda buyuk bir fark var. Bu iki yilda en cok turist gonderen 30 ulkeye bakalim. 
Burada ki grafikte ise turistlerin kisi basi harcadigi para dolar olarak gosterilmekte burada da gordugumuz gibi 950 dolar dan 775 in altina dusmus olsada son yillarda artan bir grafik var. 
Biliyorum ki son 10 yillik donemde turk lirasi buyuk deger kaybetti. Bu deger kayibi turistlerin para birimini daha degerli kildigindan, turistlerin harcamalari ayni duzeyde kalsa dahi, alabilecegi servis ve urun fiyatlari turistlerin para birimine gore daha dusuk olacaktir. Buda normalde harcayacagi turk lirasindan daha az harcamasina sonuc dogurur. Bu sebeple turk lirasi ve dolar arasindaki kur farkinin grafigine de gorelim.
source.8349069b:
In this graph, we see the previous 4 graphs we went over together. In the correlation test we will do later, we will see the relationship between them together with the numbers.

-

Bu grafikte daha once yaptigimiz 4 grafigi beraber goruyoruz. Daha sonra yapacagimiz korelasyon testinde de aralarindaki pozitif veya negatif iliskiyi rakamlarla beraber gorecegiz.
source.8e9ea7bf: ## *Avarage Number of Tourist by Month*
source.954f8b5f:
Hello guys,

In this data analysis, I will try to get numerical answers to the questions that I am personally curious about.

I have included these questions in my analysis as a result of some of my observations and experiences, as I was born and raised in Istanbul and have worked in the service sector from time to time in tourism resorts.

-

Merhaba arkadaslar,

Bu veri analizinde, kisisel olarak merak ettigim sorularin rakamsal olarak karsiligini almaya calisacagim.

Dogma buyume Istanbul'lu olmamin verdigi tecrubeler ve zaman zaman turizm beldelerinde servis sektorunde calismis oldugumdan, bazi gozlemlerim ve duyumlarim sonucu
bu sorulari analizimde bulundurdum.
source.9957867f:
What we see in the chart are the three continents that visited Turkey the most.
The fact that it is fluctuating shows us that the tourism season is concentrated in one season.
We see that there are more European tourists in the majority. Following this are the Commonwealth of Independent States and Asia.
As you may have noticed, a small drop in 2009 is due to the fact that, as you guessed, terrorist attacks started especially in Istanbul, I think. Particularly, the Taksim bombing attack may have frightened the tourists.
The reason for its sharp fall in 2016 is the coup d'etat in June and the continuation of terrorism throughout the year.
In 2019, of course, covid-19.

-

Grafikte gordugumuz ulkemizi ziyaret eden en cok uc kita.
Dalgali bir sekilde olmasi, bize turizm sezonunun bir sezonda yogunlastigini gostermekte.
Cogunlukta Avrupali turistlerin daha cok oldugunu goruyoruz. Bunu takip eden Bagimsiz Devletler Toplulugu ve Asya.
Farkettiginiz gibi 2009 yilinda kucuk bir dusus bunun sebebi tahmin ettiginiz gibi terror ataklarinin ozellikle Istanbulda baslamis olmasindan kaynakli oldugunu dusunuyorum. Ozellikle Taksim bombali saldiri turistleri korkutmus olabilir.
2016 yilinda ki keskin dususu sebebi ozellikle Haziran ayindaki darbe ve yil boyunca terorun devam etmesi.
2019 yilinda ki ise tabiki covid-19.
source.905da354: ### *Total Number of Tourist by Year*

Here, we are looking at the tourism annual revenue table, which shows an increase, just like our previous table, except for between 2014 and 2016.

-

Except for 2015 and 2019, we can see that the number of tourists has increased. We see that in 2019 before the pandemic, total number of tourists reached almost 45 million people.

-

Ozellikle ulkemizi tercih eden turistlerin devletleri arasindaki artis veya dususun yani sira, turist sayisinin 2016 disinda arttigini gorebiliyoruz.

source.01de9c41:
What we see in this graph are the 30 countries that experienced the most growth in total tourist numbers after 2015 compared to before 2015. After 2015, the number of tourists increased by almost 400% from Qatar and by almost 300% from Bahrain. When we look at the rest of the list, we cannot see any developed European country or 1st World country.

-

Bu Grafikte ki gordugumuz ise 2015 ten onceye gore, 2015 ten sonra en cok yuzdesel olarak artis yasayan 30 ulke. Katar dan neredeyse %400, Bahreyn neredeyse %300 turist artisi gostermis 2015 oncesine gore. Geri kalan listeye baktigimizda ise gelismis hic bir Avrupa ulkesi veya 1.Dunya devleti goremiyoruz.
source.9403c069:
Here I have the sum of the tourists who came before and after 2015

-

Burada 2015 den once ve sonra gelen turistlerin toplamini aliyorum
source.e97ae606: ### *Comparison of Tourist Countries in Recent Years*
source.a2ada7d2:
Here, on the other hand, I divided the sum of tourists individually by country that came after 2015 by the ones that came before 2015 and subtracted 1. The rate shows how much more or less a country has come before 2015, as a percentage, according to the countries.

-

Burada ise 2015 ten sonra geleni , 2015 ten once gelene bolerek ve 1 cikarttim. Cikan oranimiz ulkelere gore hangi ulkenin 2015 ten onceye gore ne kadar fazla veya az geldigini yuzdesel olarak gostermektedir.
source.4f4b5324:
What we see in the graph are the 30 countries that experienced the most decline in tourist numbers after 2015 compared to before 2015. 66% fewer tourists came from Japan and 63% less from Italy, and when we look at the rest of the list, it is obvious that predominantly European and 1st World countries prefer Turkey less. The reasons for this can be attributed to Turkey's terror problem and its foreign policy.

-

Grafikte ki gordugumuz 2015 ten sonra, 2015 ten onceye gore en cok dusus yasayan 30 ulke. Japonya dan %66, Italya dan %63 daha az turist gelmis ve listenin geri kalanina baktigimizda cogunlukla Avrupa ve 1.Dunya ulkelerinin Turkiye yi daha az tercih ettikleri cok acik olmaktadir. Bunun sebeblerinde Turkiye nin teror sorunu ve dis politikamiza baglayabiliriz.
source.507f2001:
In this graph, I compared the increase/decrease of the total income, the value of Turkish Lira, the number of tourists, and the per capita expenditure of the tourists as a percentage to the previous period. Between 2008 and 2010, even though the total number of tourists increased, it is seen that there was a slight decrease in tourist revenues due to the decrease in per capita expenditure of tourists.
Let's take a look at the correlation coefficients between them.

-

Bu grafikte ise toplam gelir, turist sayisi, turk lirasinin deger grafigi ve turistlerin kisi basi harcagi paranin yuzdesel olarak bir onceki doneme gore artis veya azalislarini birbiri ile karsilastirdim. 2008 ve 2010 yillari arasinda, toplam turist sayisi artmis olsa bile, turistlerin kisi basi harcamasi dusmus olmasindan kaynakli, turist gelirlerinde cok az dusmus oldugu gorulmekte. 
Hadi bir de aralarindaki korelasyon kaysayilarina bakalim.
source.38e3f4ec:
I'm translating the columns into English for everyone to understand.

-

Kolonlari herkesin anlamasi amaciyla Ingilizce'ye ceviriyorum.
